item.title: Indiana Jones And The Great Circle Launches In April On PS5
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/indiana-jones-and-the-great-circle-launches-in-april-on-ps5/1100-6530308/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Bethesda and MachineGames have announced that Indiana Jones and the Great Circle will launch for PS5 on April 17. They also released a new trailer featuring voice actors Troy Baker and Nolan North opening up a box containing a glowing blue hue, referring to PlayStation's primary color.

Those who preorder the game will receive the Last Crusade pack, which includes a Traveling Suit outfit for Indy as well as a Lion Tamer whip. The Premium Edition comes with a digital artbook and a Temple of Doom outfit, as well as a copy of the game in either digital or physical formats. It also includes up to two days of early access and the upcoming The Order of the Giants story DLC.

The Collector's Bundle is available too. It contains the Premium Edition, a steelbook case, an adventure journal, an Allmaker replica, and a globe with hidden storage.

Earlier this month, an ESRB rating for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle popped up, indicating that a release date could possibly be revealed soon. The game also racked up four million players on Xbox and PC since its debut back in December before the PS5 release.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle has won several awards, including Outstanding Achievement in Character, Outstanding Achievement in Story, and Adventure Game of the Year at the 2025 Dice Awards. It also won the Best Acting award for Troy Baker's performance as Indy at the New York Game Awards 2025.

In GameSpot's Indiana Jones and the Great Circle review, we said, "Indiana Jones and The Great Circle takes an unexpectedly stealthy and freeform approach, making for a faithful, rip-roaring adventure in which you truly embody the famous archeologist."

The next Bethesda game that could be making its way over to PS5 is Starfield, as it was recently discovered that the Bethesda Creation Kit website for the game was updated with the PlayStation logo.

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
